TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed XmlSerializationFixupCallback extends System.MulticastDelegate
Public Delegate Sub XmlSerializationFixupCallback(fixup As Object)
type XmlSerializationFixupCallback = delegate of obj -> unit

Docs.param: An instance of the class that contains the object to be fixed and the array of string identifiers for the items to fill in.
Docs.summary: Delegate used by the class for deserialization of SOAP-encoded XML data.

remarks.format:
## Remarks While deserializing XML documents into .NET Framework objects, the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure dynamically instantiates fix-up methods that implement the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationFixupCallback> delegate. The infrastructure does so for SOAP-encoded arrays whose data types map to .NET Framework reference types. Then, as necessary, a fix-up method is called to fill in the objects in the array.
In addition, during initialization, the .NET Framework XML serialization infrastructure dynamically generates and compiles a temporary class for deserialization derived from the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationReader> class. During this process, the infrastructure generates <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationFixupCallback> methods for SOAP-encoded, multi-referenced XML data. The methods are then invoked during deserialization.
Do not directly create an instance of the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.XmlSerializationFixupCallback> class.
SOAP encoding is described in Section 5 of the SOAP 1.1 specification.
